title: PMN Caecilia
content:
**[Indices](http://web.archive.org/web/20131023060111/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Indices) : [Typefaces](http://web.archive.org/web/20131023060111/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Typefaces) : PMN Caecilia**

![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131023060111im_/http:/sampler.linotype.com/fontbadges/150/1313.gif)

Caecilia, designed by [Peter Matthias Noordzij](http://web.archive.org/web/20131023060111/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Peter%20Matthias%20Noordzij), was issued by [Linotype](http://web.archive.org/web/20131023060111/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Linotype) in 1991 as PMN Caecilia in a range of [weights](http://web.archive.org/web/20131023060111/http:/typophile.com/wiki/weight), including [small caps](http://web.archive.org/web/20131023060111/http:/typophile.com/wiki/small%20capitals) and [text figures](http://web.archive.org/web/20131023060111/http:/typophile.com/wiki/text%20figures). This face is (perhaps) the first [neohumanist](http://web.archive.org/web/20131023060111/http:/typophile.com/wiki/neohumanist) [slab serif](http://web.archive.org/web/20131023060111/http:/typophile.com/wiki/slab%20serif), with a true slab serifed [italic](http://web.archive.org/web/20131023060111/http:/typophile.com/wiki/italic) to match. The italic is based on renaissance parameters, meaning it slopes at 5°. This face is a graceful and sturdy slab serif, useful for various applications.
